title: A timeline of Sam Altman's firing and dramatic return to OpenAI
relevance_explanation: The document is highly relevant as it provides a detailed timeline of the events surrounding Sam Altman's firing from OpenAI and subsequent developments, directly addressing the research goal of understanding the sequence of events and actions that followed the firing.
summary: The document outlines the sequence of events following Sam Altman's firing from OpenAI, including Altman's short-lived move to Microsoft, the reactions of OpenAI staff and investors, and Altman's eventual reinstatement as CEO with a new board of directors.
events: Nov. 17: OpenAI board fires CEO, co-founder Sam Altman and President Greg Brockman; Mira Murati named as interim CEO
Nov. 18: Sam Altman's firing reported as due to communication issues, not malfeasance
Nov. 18: Khosla Ventures expresses support for Altman
Nov. 18: OpenAI employees consider quitting or joining Altman's future ventures
Nov. 19: Altman deliberates on returning to OpenAI or starting a new AI company
Nov. 20: Microsoft hires Altman, Brockman, and others for AI research
Nov. 20: OpenAI appoints Emmett Shear as interim CEO and considers a merger; staff threaten to quit
Nov. 20: OpenAI investors weigh legal action against the board
Nov. 21: Altman reinstated as CEO with a new board along with the return of Greg Brockman
